post.author: KB
post.content:
<JUnit>
After attending .Net user group meeing tonight, I spent some time adding a Student test case. Currently it works well with Address.

I will be adding more relationships soon:
- consulting history
- course records
- education history

<Model build>
I checked in a build file - build.xml - to build a model jar file. The following is how you build the model.
1) Right-click on build.xml
2) Select Run As -> Ant Build
3) After a successful run, it will generate myschool.jar. You need to refresh the folder to see the generated file.
4) Copy the jar file as needed. e.g WEB-INF/lib. Now you can use the model API.
post.title: JUnit pass 56%, source code build started
